(Warning: May cause erection without warning). -================================================================- For anyone who doesn't know what Garry's Mod is: a) You can do pretty much anything. Yep, anything. Create an entire civilization of flying bacon-flavoured waffles only to have them destroyed by a giant-mutant-cyborg toaster from outer space if you want; I don't care. Oh yeah, and it's multiplayer. b) If you don't want to make things or just mess around like that (if so, what is wrong with you?), then you can play more serious or just generally less-creative game modes like 'Trouble in Terrorist Town', 'Zombie Survival' or 'Prop Hunt' (among hundreds of other modes). c) The fun never ends; The Gmod community is one of the largest and most-active gaming communities out there! New mods, models, maps and gamemodes are constantly coming out, plus there's also the hundreds of thousands of things that have already been made. Essentialy, you're always playing Garry's Mod, but you're also playing over a hundred games inside of it. d) If you haven't heard of Garry's Mod, then where have you been hiding? You'd need to completely cut yourself off from the outside world to not have heard of it. You should be ashamed of yourself. So all-in-all, you're paying a small fee to provide yourself with (at minimum) hundreds of hours of awesomely spazztastic fun. At this price, you should feel guilty. Especially with all of the new FREE STUFF that comes out. I would gladly pay 80 or 100 to have this game. Honestly. Not kidding. For real. If you (for some reason) can only have one game ever, then make sure it's this game. I've seen people put in almost 2,000 hours for this game. NOW FOR THE FINAL SCORE -=======================- I have never given a game 100% because surely that's not possible. There's never been a perfect game. Yeah well if you thought that too, you're wrong. Gmod ISN'T a game. It's like thousands of tiny-and-equally-awesome games all in one. 10/10 without any doubt whatsoever. If you disagree, would you kindly go kill yourself please? Thank you.

game-hours: 415.4
review: From the exterior, Gmod seems like one of those games where you play it, realize how stupid and/or boring it is, and never pick it up again. Well, my friend! You are so wrong! First of all, there are several gamemodes to play - want to shoot some terrorists, but want to do some sleuthing while you're at it? Trouble in Terrorist Town. Want to make a giant  out of random props? Sandbox. Want to pretend you're the pickle inspector? DarkRP. Want to play hide and seek, but with random objects replacing the hiders, and futuristic super-soldiers from Half-Life 2 as the seekers? Prop Hunt! Also, don't forgot the great modding capability - as mentioned earlier, there are THOUSANDS of community-made gamemodes out there. Gmod fully supports modding, having it's own workshop and all. Which brings me to my next point, you can download extra stuff from the Workshop. Want to take candid photos of an awkwardly made Shrek model? Download an awkwardly made Shrek model and whip out yer camera! Want to blow some crap up? Download a weaponry mod. Want to survive against badly-coded zombies? Download a Zombie mod! Want to run around an abandoned hospital? Download a hospital map! The possibilities are endless! Don't forget about the community! Sure, there are some s out there, and by some I mean quite a bit, but don't let that let you down! Find a nice little server, join their forums and instantly gain HUNDREDS OF FRIENDS*! *may not actually be true

game-hours: 755.7
review: The amount of things you can do with this, and all of the mods, I'd truely recommend this. For example, you may want to construct stuff and make cool contraptions in sandbox mode, the default mode. Or, you may want to play a different version of something, like hidden, taken from the hidden source mod. Heck, there's even a bomberman mod, called melonbomber, and that sure is fun. If you want to see how good you are under pressure and putting the pieces together of a murder while around a bunch of people you can't trust because they can kill you at any moment, then Trouble in Terrorist Town is very fun, even if you don't want to detect anything you can just wait for someone to be identified as a traitor, and use the custom guns in some servers to kill them, or if you happen to be a traitor, get a bunch of fun equipment and kill someone creatively. Overall, Gmod is a very popular game with loads of mods, and for a good reason. It's the multipurpose game, because it doesn't have one genre, it has many. Many many many many genres. All the videos on garry's mod aren't really accurate, like the trouble in terrorist town videos or just general gmod construction videos, because the people playing them are doing it for "fun" (Being idiots and not bothering to actually accomplish anything) and have no idea what they're doing, like a lot of TTT videos have people RDMing others, which just takes the fun out of the game, even if it is fun to watch. If you watch a single video of Gmod by one of the popular youtubers, you can catch many things they missed. As it stands, I recommend this game a LOT, simply for the fact of it being able to be whatever game you want it to be.

review: I would recomend this game only to people who have or are planning on buying counter-strike: source. Most of the textures in this came are taken from CSS which makes it hard to play for anyone who doesn't own CSS. I would also only recomend buying this if you have friends who also play because without a set storyline this game is quite boring to play alone. A good Idea would be for someone to post the CSS texture files in the Workshop for this game for those who don't own CSS. Idk if thats legal or not but it would be helpful. Overall this game is great and completely unique, but on a scale of "Yes" to "No" I would rate it: "On The Fence".

review: Garry's Mod, a game of games... In Garry's Mod (or you can call it Gmod) you do whatever you want. It also helps that it's supported by Steam workshop! You can even play gamemodes such as Murder, Trouble in Terrorists Town, Prophunt, and DarkRP! Overall, Garry's Mod is a superb game, it's my favorite game in fact and I highly recommend you give it a try!

review: As someone that doesn't find "build anything you want" games to be fun I really could care less about the sandbox potential, and even if I did, the physics engine, like many others, doesn't exactly work well with the concept of precision and Newton's Laws of Motion (the main issue being how objects in motion in GMod interact with NPCs and player characters in a less-than-relativistic fashion). With that all said, however, the ability for the community to create custom game modes has resulted in a lot of interesting, fun and somewhat unique multiplayer experiences, which include Trouble in Terrorist Town, Jailbreak, Dark RP, just to name some of the more popular ones.

game-hours: 2757.1
review: I've played Garry's Mod for over four thousand hours, meaning even before they tracked time on steam games, there's almost unlimited possibilities for this mod turned game. I've seen games that cater to creative minds who wish for nearly limitless possibilities with a physics engine(Sandbox), those who want a serious roleplay experience(SRP/HL2RP), those who want to feel helpless or want to slaughter innocents(TTT), those who have always wanted to do stupid  in a city-like enviroment(DarkRP), and even just people who want simple minigames, or fun small mods(Elevator: Source). The downsides? They depend on your computer, partially if you want to dock game content onto your GMOD(Loading up HL2, CS:S, TF2, ect for content). Every gamemode and server provides a different style and feel, and are not just the only things Garry's Mod has to offer. Hell, you might even waste hours looking for some server or gamemode that feels fun to play. Overall, I've probabally spent the most time on Garry's Mod out of any other game I own(And I mean it, I've beaten HL2 over 52 times now, at the time of posting), and it's tooken up a fraction of my life, I've met good friends, made enemies, watch communities die and grow, dealt with DDoSs, awful admins, and permabans on this game, and it's a damn journey, I'll give 'ya that. tl;dr: 4000+ hrs on game, buy HL2, and buy the CS:S and Gmod bundle, it's worth it.

review: Oh man, where do I even start with this game. Garry's Mod is one of a kind, and it's the only game out there truely like it with all the content it contains. This game has downloadable content, customization, addons, and so much stuff. Of course, there isn't just Sandbox. There's TTT, a very popular one. DarkRP and other RP's are also popular. So much to do, so little time. Just ask my 1000+ hours. I've invested a portion of my life into this game and the servers on it, and I was not dissapointed.

game-hours: 2069.0
review: Garry's Mod, if you ever feel the need to just build a giant  out of random junk, then here is the place. In single player you can spawn props from games like TF2, Counter Strike and the Half Life series also you can spawn props from other Valve games that you download, but the fun doesn't stop there, you can also spawn enemies from the Half Life series and shoot the living  out of them. You can go into no clip mode and play god as you send a force of the vortigants after a bunch of antilions, you can also download new props, vehicles, weapons and npc's from the Steam Workshop. The multiplayer of Garry's Mod is also just as fun, It's hard to tell how many game modes there are, but the ones to look into are the zombie survival, prop hunt, death runs and trouble in terrorist town. But you should really experiment with the game modes and get a feel for them. I hope this was of some help.

review: Oh Garry's Mod, you have entertained me for hours. Yet it's really hard to make an review for this game. as it is more of a "engine" for a lot of games within this game. Think of Garry's Mod as a really weird canvas which many have created awesome art on. It's just hard to describe. If you're not satisfied easily then this game might be excelent for you. Why? Well as this game has way more to offer then just messing around, it offers so much more then an average "real game" would these days. For this exact reason I love this "game", it allows being f*cked around in, but aswell gives this incredeble freedom which others might not exploit but build on. If you're not certain if you want it I strongly recommend checking if you have more Source games in your Steam Libary such as Counter Strike: Source and Half Life 2 (and episodes) since Garry's Mod (or GMOD) uses them as resources for texures and items you wouldn't want to miss out on, since most servers use these textures aswell you basicly need them to get the full expierence out of this game! (Yes I did it, I called this "Garry's MOD" a game!) So I'd recoomend this game to everyone that just... wants to have fun!

review: This is most likely one of the greatest sandbox games on the Steam Webstore with plenty of things to do from making a floating piece of wood with some decorations to a motorised bathtub to a fully functunal ship! Or just stack up wooden objects and set them on fire. And if the vanilla version doesn't grab your tastes, get some addons! This game has an outstanding number of addons that can be downloaded with a click of a button! Some addons are made for great new building experiences, take Expression 2 and Wiremod for example, with the use of wiremod you can create working doors and other things (not that good with wiremod so can't give detailed explanation) and with Expression 2 you can make Holograms, Teleporters and big explosions. Although this is an amazing game and I HIGHLY recommend it to anyone who's looking for a unique sandbox experience there is probably only ONE thing that I dislike about it... And it's that if you don't have certain games like Half Life or Counter Strike, some textures and models won't work, this include black and pink checkerboxes and big flashing Errors signs, (luckily I have found a way around this, check out this website to get free models and textures from games such as Portal, Half Life and Counter Strike

review: Garry's mod isn't a game. It's a tool to produce art, whether that be for creating screenshots, testing custom models, designing contraptions with Wire or animating videos for youtube. Its also a great multiplayer experience. Invite your friends along and play some private PvP, play through an Adventure map or a Horror map, Boot up a pre-existing source game and play through it with added weapons and rules. Half-Life 2s single player with six players all wield weapons from Halo 2 would make for an interesting experience wouldnt it? If none of that takes your fancy download a custom map, enable third party models and run a Role-play server. Metro 2033, My Little Pony, Fallout- all youll need is a map which fits the theme- Player models and items ripped from said game and you can role-play to your hearts content. Gmod is also great for custom game modes such as Trouble for Terrorist town which provide a truly unique experience. For such a cheap price tag I would recommend Gmod for anyone who enjoys PC Gaming. Since it provides its users a unique experience every time you play. (Requires HL2, ep1.2, CS:S & DoD to work correctly)

review: Garry's Mod has blown up to be so strong and full of support, it can practically be any game ever made. This sandbox toolkit allows the building of completely awesome structures and devices and the creation of awesome game modes using .lua file structures. In other words: FUN. Want to play racing like mariokart? There are servers for that. Want to act like a homeless person in a city? There are servers for that. Do you want to play something like Quake? You guessed right, more servers. The possibilities with Garry's Mod in the future is great. Admitingly, the Source engine is starting to lose some of it's luster as far as graphics go. Still, Garry's Mod is a solid buy.

review: My God Garry's mod is the best game on steam by far. If this your first source game you will need to download a source game in order for this to work. Team Fortress 2 is free and is a source game! You don't even need to buy css, in the workshop you can download css packs which give you all the materials and models for free! Now the gameplay consists of 2 modes, single player and multiplayer. Single player allows you to screw around on different maps and do whatever. Now the multiplayer is the reason you should buy this. So many wonderful gamemodes. Consisting of roleplay, jailbreak, trouble in terrorist town and much more! This game is being constantly driven by the community, they are constantly uploading stuff to play with. Did I mention you can spawn watermelons? The watermelons in this game are so appetizing and rich! Best feature by far! 69/10 Watermelons take the cake for me on this game

review: At first when you buy Garry's mod, you're like "wtf do I do." Then you learn the controls and realize there's nothing to do in the game. And then out of the blue you're getting the acheivement for playing 8 consecutive hours on the same map and server. And then out of the blue you get the acheivement for having a full year worth of your life invested into this game. Seriously worth it, and if you're thinking it isn't worth it, buy CS:Source, HL2, and then buy this game. Your life will be forever altered.

review: One does not simply review Garry's Mod. Like, seriously. No one could possibly describe this game. If you can think it, it probably can exist in Garry's Mod. There are gamemodes that are so awesome, well, yeah. They're amazing. You have Trouble in Terrorist Town and Murder, your very own psychopath simulators/stealth games. You have a number of different Roleplaying types, including DarkRP, MafiaRP, Star Wars RP, GangWarsRP (I think), and a number of other bizarre roleplaying types. You have your random gamemodes, like SledBuild (building a sled and racing it), Flood (build your raft, try to survive the oncoming fight), and the infamous GMOD Tower, which is like Garry's Mod inside Garry's Mod. With hats. Yeah, it's pretty awesome.

review: Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. We give you the tools and leave you to play. You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions - whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet - that's up to you. If you're not too great at construction - don't worry! You can place a variety of characters in silly positions.

game-hours: 5299.1
review: In a sea of bland darkRP servers and uninspired TTT clones, one stands above them all. Hellsgamer's is the pinnacle of excellence. They raise the bar in aspects. The gameplay itself is flawless, with humans spawncamping the zombie team with a diverse pool of weapons for the entirety of the game, never faltering. The sublime selection of levels the server has to offer is astounding, with five second fps black holes, to hallways longer than the sun, truly remarkable. Finally, the friendly community that has kept this gamemode ahead of the pack. With in-game points for sale, with real money, the spawncamping never ceases. They have set the bar for administration, banning members of the Noxiousnet community, who's version of zombiesurvival is undoubtedly superior. The brave new world Hellsgamers has created for us is waiting to be explored.

game-hours: 122.3
review: Audiovisually Garry's Mod still has the charm of pretty much all of Valve's source games which bare a strong resemblence to Half-Life 2. However due to the nature of Garry's Mod being a very moddable game it can be all over the place if you are utilising the workshop. Gameplay wise Garry's Mod offers the great stability and is rather easy to use. Much of the gameplay depends on what modded gamemode you play but throughout almost all it is sound. Focusing specifically on the primary gamemode, "Sandbox Mode", the tools given to create and destroy all work effectively and easily. Overall Garry's Mod is a brilliant idea that has formed into millions of games in one. Easily the best game for the price.

review: Garry's mod. Garry's mod is a game where you play and spend your first few hours doing dum crap like flinging your first rag doll around like a savage then you start building stuff like box's or some peoples favorite  or spawn seagulls and shoot them with your favorite gun. Then you discover it THE ADDONS or MULTIPLAYER BROWSER then it's feels like a whole new game again. when you get your 50+ addons or playing multiplayer show people your glory's prop  or shooting people or props in gamemodes like TTT or prop hunt. This is a game where you can spend hour upon hours of mostly high end fun but there is times where you will get mad at the game because you can't just get that prop the way you want it or there is someone being a mingebag or A$$-hat. Would i recommend this game YES! p.s get the counter strike source + Garry's mod and save your self the pain of seeing errors.

review: As you can see, I've been playing this game for a very long time. This game is one of the best games I've played, and easily goes on my top 3 list. At first, it was hard to get into. A lot of stuff to learn, experience, and do. You decide if that is a positive note or not. Even after 2+ years, I still find myself getting on once in a while, craving that creative side of me that makes me want to build things. This game is not just one thing. This game is many games in one. There are at least 100+ different gamemodes I've played. Most of them are really good. But if you do get this, try not to get sucked into Gmod Tower. It's really addictive. So yes. I really would reccomend you get this game if you're a creative individual looking to do what you want, when you want, without boundaries or limits. The only limit is your imagination.

review: Awesome game. Originally this game is based around in using your imagination and you are given the right tools in order to make your imagination come true. Purely from building, it is a fantastic game because you have LOTS of tools to choose from and many different techniques to make your item that you're building work. You can build stuff from a simple car by building a plank, adding wheels and making the wheels move in whichever direction you want to building a huge ship with lots of details inside it and allowing your friends enter the ship (Multiplayer). Excluding the main purpose of the game of building, this game has great variety of mods whether it's a gameplay mode of TTT (Trouble in a Terrorist Town) or Cinema mode. There are lots to choose from and each mode are unique in each way. If you are buying this game then definitely get some friends over for a multiplayer game because it will make your time much more better! This game gives you lots of free choices and many tools, many modifications, many gameplay modes in order to continously count up your gameplay hours! Definitely worth it's price!

game-hours: 386.8
review: Garry's mod is hands down the best sandbox game you can ever find. The only goal is to do whatever you want, however you want. In this game, you can smash watermelons, spawn a heavy, drive a turbo bathtub, fight zombies, spawn the G-Man, shoot NPCs, fly to the moon in a cargo box... The list goes on and on and on. Sandbox mode allows you to do whatever you can imagine! And, once your tired of that, there are tons of gamemodes on multiplayer just waiting to be played! The gamemodes range from multiplayer sandbox to prop hunting, and a twisted terrorist version of clue (TTT). The community can sometimes be a little annoying, but if you find a good server, you will have tons of fun! This game will never make you bored due to the fact that the community has literally tens of thousands of weapons, maps, cars, and any other addon you can think of. I would suggest buying the CS:S + Garry's Mod pack because most of the multiplayer gamemodes require CS:S content to play. I have had this game for 3 years and I'm still having fun with it! My rating: 10/10

review: Great fun and highly addictive! You discover something new and amazing every time you launch the game! Garry's Mod is great for experimenting and playing with things. Build traps, secret bases, houses or even Rube Goldberg Machines! Steam Workshop integration was the most perfect idea for this game, allowing mod making nooblings, such as me, to upload wacky dupes, such as yours truly's "The Kleinstain", a nightmarish idea that sprung into mind. I would STRONGLY reccomend this game as it's just so unpredictable what you might find! game-hours: 306.0
review: GMOD is a game which really brings players together. Through its countless amount of gamemodes, users can play games with friends doing various things, such as sandbox (the default gamemode) or others made by third parties like jailbreak, morbus and so on. Not only does the game have plenty of playable content, you can even create your own through the ease of map making and item making using various software such as 3d modeling software. Thankfully the game has plenty of community items to add through the use of the steam workshop which adds more fun to an ever increasing game. There are plenty of gamemodes which in my opinion stand out, of which some I have already mentioned but others include Trouble in terrorist town, Hunger Games and Stop It Slender. Gary Newman in my opinion really hit the nail on the head with this game, it's ideas to create a game which is managed by different communities is a great addition. The only drawback I find is that when loading into servers the page freezes for the login period, this could be fixed which would make the game even better for me. I seriously recommend anyone who is a community player, someone who loves playign their favourite games with others and also people who are creative as GMOD allows ones creative mind to flow.

game-hours: 70.5
review: This game is really not your normal game, and I suppose you can see that from most of the screeshots. Sandbox games are powered by others, and what they create, to be honest, without downloading anything from the Steam Workshop, the game can get boring fast, it's loaded with 2 pre-made maps with valve to goof around and get a hang of the core components of the game. But then that's where TTT comes in (Trouble In Terrorist Town), it's an incredibly unique game mode that's very fun and there is really nothing else quite like it. And playing a custom downloaded game mode or map can be an incredibly hilarious and generally enjoyable experience to have. Overall this game can provide endless fun if you play it in the right way. The visuals are nothing groundbreaking, but it is a almost direct port of Half Life 2, so if you have played it then you know what your getting into. Hope this review helped

review: Garry's mod is one of the best community driven games on the PC. Garry's Mods has a variety of gamemodes from sled build to Trouble in Terrorist town(TTT), and even Rolepaly servers. After Playing the game for some where around 24 hours I can gladly give this game an 8/10. I didnt give it anything higher because it doesent work to its fullest advantage with out the other Valve titles.

review: One may look at Garry's Mod and say, "Oh, you can do anything. Cool." without giving the game a thorough look. Deeper inside Garry's mod, you find that it isn't only posing ragdolls from Source games and giving them silly faces. There is a variety of seperate gametypes to choose from, whether you construct things with your friends, solve a mystery and find a killer in the old-fashioned "who-dun-it" matter, or even building boats to stay afloat in a flood. The options are nearly endless, as Steam Workshop creators can make things for Garry's Mod. This game will keep you playing for hours and hours, no matter what gamemode you play. Note: This game IS better when you play it with friends.

game-hours: 281.3
review: This game is so awesome and fun! You can do everything you want, from fun multiplayer minigames like Prop Hunt or Trouble in Terrorist Town to horror maps, to wars with guns that have graphics like Battlefield. You can build stuff, create houses, do fun games with NPC's and let your imagination flow! There are so many workshop addons, ranging from anime NPC's to weapon packs. There is everything you can imagine in Garry's Mod. There are maps with an intense war like Combine Onslaught and the dozens of millions of zombie survival maps, but also family friendly things like downloadable cars and racing maps (although the racing controls are really stiff). There is even a huge NPC that is the final boss of Doom 3, it's so much fun to spawn some cute anime girls NPC's, make them invincible, give them weapons and fight against that monster while it's spawning other monsterse at you, that boss even got a boss theme, and in the right map it's just intense. There are even Skyrim dragons as boss! It's just so much you can do in this game, you never get bored of it. But something that I don't like is that the achievements are IMPOSSIBLE, I stalk Garry (the creator) every day to see if he's playing the game, to join him and get that darn achievement. Anyways, this game is awesome and really fun. 9.5/10

game-hours: 266.0
review: This game is the pinnacle of showing what the pc community and the modding community can do. I could not recommend this game more. This is a must own game for PC and is constantly being updated with new mods and gamemodes to play. This game is home to classic games like prophunt and TTT. The only downside I see with this is it requires many downloads to get the textures used, and if it's on sale, I would recommend buying the CS source package with this game, as alot of textures and maps come from that game. Otherwise, just download a CS source mod that gives you most of the textures and maps from CS, but be ready to see a few giant error signs, especially in prop hunt if you choose this option. 8/10

review: Definitely a top pick! Never really knew what this game was until I finally played it when a friend recommended it to me. It went on sale and I decided to give it a try, and I can honestly say that I was not disappointed. Garry's Mod is esentially a bunch of smaller games roled into one title. Using Half Life 2 as a base, it edits its gameplay mechanics to create an entirely new experience for players, with even more content and creativity added in by the community. This is definitely a great go-to-game if you have some friends to play with and want an entertaining time waster.

review: This "game" is pretty much the bare bones for pretty much anything you can think of. If you know basic video editing skills, you can make awesome videos with this. If you know how to adjust settings and put together objects, you can make cool screenshots. If you know how to script with Lua, you can make fun gamemodes. The list goes on and on. If you're just a consumer and you don't really want to be productive, you can always join a server with a gamemode like Murder, Prop Hunt, or even Bunny Hop. With Garry's Mod, there's something for everyone, the developers and the players.

game-hours: 102.8
review: Dis Game is FUN.... ololo
game-hours: 258.3
review: A hilarious game mode that attracted me in as soon as i started playing it. I was first attracted to Garry's Mod from Youtube, mostly from Trouble in Terrorist Town, but my interest was piqued by many more game modes when I opened the servers list. Dark RP is an amazing roleplaying gamemode which has you pick a job and live among others. The people can sometimes troll, but whenever that happens, just have a laugh yourself. TTT, on the other hand, brings you into a scenario of 3 people, the Traitor, Innocent, and Detective. The Traitor is amazing (my favorite) to play, strategizing the best way to kill everyone on the map with your fellow comrade(s). Another gamemode (or multiple gamemodes should i say) that I loved was Gmod Tower. It was almost a hotel, where you could get a room and decorate it using furniture. Where did you get this furniture? From games or course! You were able to match up against players in different gamemodes, and reap your rewards to decorate yourself, your room, and even give you an edge up in some games. All in all, Garry's Mod is an amazing game which I would reccomend to anyone looking for a good waste of time that isn't strict at all.

game-hours: 97.3
review: This game is just ugh. its like babycrack. If you seriously don't know by now, Garry's Mod is a sandbox game with no specific or predetermined goals in mind, meaning you can do whatever you want. PROS While the default sandbox gamemode is fun, there is a really strong comminuty for this game that will recreate just about anything into this game. These are packaged into the game as addons, are there are several of them to download through the steam workshop. Some of my favoritee gamemodes include Trouble in Terrorist Town, a mod that is now bundled in the game, where there are several innocents trying to find the one or very few traitors, who try to kill innocents, and Prop Hunt, hide and seek on crack, where there is one team morphing into map props, and another team trying to kill the props. CONS The only con is that unless you wanna see error alot, you really need to buy CS:S, but since that game is great too, i don't mind.

game-hours: 95.6
review: Garry's Mod is hours of entertainment and a game that I highly recommend. It's on sale on Steam often enough, so if you don't have it, buy it. It's a sandbox-style game that can load content from a number of Source games (TF2, HL2 etc.), as well as having a great selection of weapons, tools, maps and saves available in the steam workshop. You can plonk stuff anywhere you like, build contraptions such as hover cars or even spawn huge weights to crush Barney under (because he still hasn't bought you that beer!) The part I find most enjoyable, though, is loading up the original Half Life 2 maps and using the GMod tools to cause havoc. Bar up doorways, set up trip-wire bombs or even find where Dr. Breen is hiding and replace him with a beach ball. And if you're the programming sort, get WireMod. You can put down a range of sensors and displays to make cool stuff like control panels where you have to turn the key and input a 4 digit code in order to set off the explosion. Takes a bit to learn, but is so much fun!

game-hours: 1413.3
review: This game is like no other game. Garry's Mod, or more commonly abbreviated as "Gmod", is a Sandbox game that lets you build anything you want. You can go into an empty building and spawn a table, chair, and a ragdoll to make it look like he is having some nice tea. Garry's Mod doesn't have any objectives. Instead, you set the objectives for yourself. Some may say, "There's a right way to play GMod." They are wrong. There is no right way to play this game. Not even a wrong way. Even GMod pros have more things to discover. The game basically gives you free will. You can do basically anything without consequence. You can spawn some NPCs and kill them. The game just gives you the tools you need and lets you be. The GMod workshop also provides great addons made by real users, for those who aren't content with the default maps, props, and ragdolls. GMod 14 better not be a flop.
game-hours: 73.4

game-hours: 21.7

game-hours: 574.4
review: Garry's Mod is one of those games which doesn't grab you at first - but once you delve deeper you realise how much potential it has. Its singleplayer building sandbox offers a wide range of props and physics manipulations. You can create really intricate machines and contraptions if you have the inclination. For me though, it's multiplayer "gamemodes" which really draw me in. Trouble in Terrorist Town, Deathrun, Surf, DarkRP, Jailbreak etc are a few community developed gamemodes which make the player fulfill a certain role. Essentially, games that could be a standalone product (especially TTT) are all available for free. If you are interested in buying Garry's Mod, then I would strongly suggest you check out these gamemodes. Word of warning though, the general player community in Garry's Mod is honestly one of the worst I have ever come across. Of course there will always be trolls; but each server generally has around 50%+ people who are really not going to be the most civil bunch you've ever met. Try to find a server which has decent admins (which I admit has become a rarity) and that you enjoy playing on.

game-hours: 342.0
review: This game is without a doubt the must-have game for Steam. It is the staple for all sandbox games and comes with an abundant supply of gamemodes/mods. The three recommended game modes to first play when starting the game for the first time is definitley the original sandbox gamemode. Its great to get a feel for the game and most of the textures and aslo isnt short of props and other creations in the menus. The second and third are Trouble in Terrorist Town and Prop hunt. TTT is one of the most entertaining mods i have ever played. When comparing TF2 prop hunt to Gmod Prop Hunt. Tf2 is shutdown. Gmod PH provides hundreds even thousands of props that you can change to anytime during the round and overall make it more fun for you to hide as something you choose. ***BIG NOTE: It is highly recommended that anyone who decides to purchase GMOD should try and purchase the Garrys Mod + Counter Strike Source bundle because several of the gamemodes use counterstrike textures and props. You can still play GMOD without CSS but in most of the TTT servers and many other gamemodes you will find loads or giant ERROR signs and missing textures due to the reliance on counterstrike. Not to dent steam revenue but waiting till there is a sale for the game itself or the bundle is the best economic purchase. Gmod and CSS are regularly on sale throughout the year. When not on sale the bundle is somewhere around $25, and when both are on sale for 50-75% off the bundle is like either $7.49 or $10. Disregarding what you spend on this amazing game it will pay for itsself time and time again, with never ending entertainment and fun. It is a must buy for and PC gamer.

review: A game where you can do whatever you want, share what you just did to the community for others to play around for it. It's a unique game, where you can experiment with your friends, family, or strangers that you just found on a server. A lot of custom game modes, where you can all do lots of different things. Ever dreamed to make a spinning baby-doll on a razor blade attached to a sonic scewdriver which is on a rocket attacked to a school with robots in who have waffles in their mouths? Guess what, you can make it! You can do whatever you want, even make a whole new invention better than all the rest! Now, no game is perfect, so my score will be fair, no game can truely be 10/10. I'll give it a... 8/10. I just love the idea of being able to experiment, make custom maps or objects and then share it with the community. This was Harichi, and thank you for reading my review.
game-hours: 116.5
review: This is just tremendously fun. At the mere price of $10 (and an accompanying Source game, but if you're on Steam, you probably have one of them already), this is probably the most value I've ever gotten from a game. The core game is great for faffing about, but the add-ons (all free!) are where it really gets fun. Want to race a Lamborghini around Dustbowl? Go ahead! Want to have a giant Hatsune Miku beat up Godzilla with a crowbar? Make it happen! And if there's some crazy idea you have that somebody else hasn't had already, you can make your own creations in Lua script and import them into the game with ease. All I have to say is just buy it already.

game-hours: 762.1
review: Not that this game needs much of a review, it is already an extremely popular and successful game but I figured I may as well just drop a note down since I do much enjoy the game. This game is so great because you can almost play it no matter what type of game you may be in the mood for. Want to sit back and enjoy some good entertainment? Go check out a cinema server and let the mounds of hilarious videos pour in while you socialize with others. Maybe you want to blast away some zombies, you can sure as hell bet there are some zombie survival servers where you fight to survive an endless amount of deadly zombies that want nothing more than to get a taste of your juicy brains! Maybe you're feeling creative today, go find a freebuild server and create almost anything your heart desires. With the addition of the wiremod plugin your creative possibilities seem almost endless. If none of this is fast paced enough for you, that's fine, we've got deathrun servers waiting for you as well! Feel your heart pound as you attempt to jump and climb through deadly traps, all controlled by the simple press of another player who wants nothing more than to see you fall in to that pit of spikes or get smashed by the giant hammer he just sent down to crush you like a little ant. Make it through all the traps and you'll be able to get your revenge by mowing him down with your sweet little smg! If none of these few examples I've given have caught your eye, don't go yet! There are plenty of other gamemodes to choose from. Just ask one of your friends that I'm sure owns the game or check out some videos online. This game is everywhere!

game-hours: 126.3
review: Garry's Mod is one of the most unique games I have ever played, for the reason that there is no overall goal. Take any other game and you'll see that, although sometimes hard to find, there is an overlying goal, something that Garry's Mod lacks, and for a good reason. This gives the user a level of freedom never before experienced, in both singleplayer and multiplayer. The multiplayer in Garry's Mod is, arguably, the best part of Garry's Mod. A few weeks ago, I watched videos of people playing Prop Hunt and Trouble in Terrorrist Town, never once believing that both game modes were part of the same game. The ease at which you can play multiplayer with your friends is unbelievable - you simply join their game, and voila, you're in. Playing Trouble in Terrorrist Town with friends is one of the best multiplayer games you can play, and only for 5.99! The one, and only, downside to Garry's Mod is the fact that it requires you to possess a Source engine game such as Counter-Strike: Source, because without this, the game is full of checkered textures and error messages. If you are going to buy this game, buy it with Counter-Strike: Source. Therefore, overall, I have to say that the 84 hours I have played of the game, split between TTT, Prop Hunt, and Death Run, reflect how great this game is. My score = 9/10

review: Garrys mod is a great game and I would recomend it to everyone considering how cheap it can be on sales and it's a real laugh with mates. The community is great on this game as well with pepole making mods all the time so it can't really get boring with the near endless amount of mods in this game. The game features building and combat with a wide range of silly mods that are tremendous fun. But you do have some kids that will annoy some pepole quite a lot but you can turn of voice chat so that dosn't mean its a problem in some cases. It's a source engine so the performence is good as every source game. It ran on my old computer which was 8 years old so the performence isn't a factor you would need to really consider. So overall I would seriously reccomend this to anyone.

review: Like Half Life? Enjoy Team Fortress 2? Spend your life trying to figure out those hard puzzles in Portal (Cause seriously, some of those are pretty brutal.). Then Garry's Mod (More famously known as G-Mod) may or may not be for you! With this game (more like a sandbox sort of thing, thats a type of game right?) you can move ragdolls of all your favorite valve (and any other models you find on the interwebs) games in any way you want. And yes, this does mean that this game is full of sexually suggestive poses and woman with hardly to no clothes on. Putting that aside, it is fun to make movies with your favorite characters, making them do something serious or funny. The game gives you plenty of tools to help you create just about anything like, tub cars, rollercoasters, and weird messed up things you can't even consider part of this humanly world. (Cause it's always fun to create something that can give you nightmares for more than a week.) I do enjoy this game and hope you find it interesting as well! -Remi (A.K.A SPIRIT)

review: A good game to get if you're a modder, like using source mods, or just want to just screw around. Ton of mods in the workshop for it too, giving you access to many NPCs, models (inanimate objects) and weapons, amoung many other things. It is, however, better if you own half life 2 and some source games (Not just TF2, things like CS: source, or Day of Defeat:Source). These allow for more maps and models to use, (though if you just want to screw around, you may well just get a source game). Also fun to use soucre mods, like Trouble in terrorist town or Zombie Panic (games you can load in Gmod). It's good fun, but even more fun with friends. Good to test new mods/custom sweps with as well.

review: A game where you can do whatever you want, share what you just did to the community for others to play around for it. It's a unique game, where you can experiment with your friends, family, or strangers that you just found on a server. A lot of custom game modes, where you can all do lots of different things. Ever dreamed to make a spinning baby-doll on a razor blade attached to a sonic scewdriver which is on a rocket attacked to a school with robots in who have waffles in their mouths? Guess what, you can make it! You can do whatever you want, even make a whole new invention better than all the rest! Now, no game is perfect, so my score will be fair, no game can truely be 10/10. I'll give it a... 8/10. I just love the idea of being able to experiment, make custom maps or objects and then share it with the community. This was Harichi, and thank you for reading my review.
game-hours: 116.5
review: This is just tremendously fun. At the mere price of $10 (and an accompanying Source game, but if you're on Steam, you probably have one of them already), this is probably the most value I've ever gotten from a game. The core game is great for faffing about, but the add-ons (all free!) are where it really gets fun. Want to race a Lamborghini around Dustbowl? Go ahead! Want to have a giant Hatsune Miku beat up Godzilla with a crowbar? Make it happen! And if there's some crazy idea you have that somebody else hasn't had already, you can make your own creations in Lua script and import them into the game with ease. All I have to say is just buy it already.

game-hours: 34.0
review: Absolutely one of the coolest games I've purchased. With all of the custom content flowing through Steam Workshop, it's impossible not to find something you like. Garry's Mod was originally a Half-Life 2 mod, but now it's $10 on Steam. While it might seem stupid to pay for it, I assure it is not. There are a ton of fun gamemodes you can download for the game right off Steam at no cost. There's "The Stalker", a fun match where one player controls an invisible creature that has to eliminate every other player (the hunters) to win. Then there's the "Murder" gamemode, where one player is secretly the murderer and has to eliminate all bystanders (usually while trying not to get caught); however, one bystander has a gun and can use it to kill the murderer and win the round for the bystanders. There are a TON of awesome gamemodes on Garry's Mod and more are always being created. If you don't have Garry's Mod and you like anything you've seen or heard about it, then I recommend buying it. Side Notes: -Graphics are nice, but can be lowered if needed (like most games, obviously) and even on my laptop I can play Gmod pretty well. -Gmod has a few issues (for example it sometimes closes out on you after downloading something in-game or, rarely, when hitting the ~ key to open the developer console. This isn't that big of a deal, though, and you can always find solutions for these kind of things. -Lastly, if you have an issue with fps when playing on servers, you can fix that by opening Steam and navigating to the games list (Right-Click Garry's Mod, click Properties, click Set Launch Properties, and enter -dxlevel 80 +mat_antialias 0 window. (I know it has nothing to do with the review, but I think everyone should know it if they want to play the game.)

game-hours: 81.2
review: Garry's Mod, a well known game thanks to Youtubers like PewDiePie and VanossGaming. And instantly you understand why they play it so much, it's very FUN! You can shoot zombies, do assault courses on Deathrun, and become a cup on Prop Hunt. BUT, before you do that you first must download the textures that you need to play properly. No, they do not tell you to do that. Your first game of Prop HUnt for example will consist of you looking at your screen confused whilst giant red ERROR signs walk around a map of black and pink squares (unless you already have the games with the correct textures). After downloading everything you need to play the game, you decide to join a snadbox server. BAD IDEA! You spawn and instantly get blown to pieces by a squealing 10 year old with a rocket launcher. If you live long enough to walk around the map, you will constantly be lagging due to the amount of vehicles and giant spaceships whizzing around. Even though there are negatives, they're not really the game devlopers fault. The rest of the gaming experience is reasonably good. There are many diffrent game modes to choose from. And you get a chance to meet new people whilst playing hide and seek, what more do you want?

review: Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. We give you the tools and leave you to play. You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions - whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet - that's up to you. If you're not too great at construction - don't worry! You can place a variety of characters in silly positions.

game-hours: 363.4
review: Garry's Mod is very fun game to play once you find a game mode that you enjoy. What stood out for me was the game mode "Trouble in Terrorist Town". You spawn in with a bunch of people, and after the timer ends, you either get chosen as a Innocent, Detective, or a Traitor. As a Traitor, your goal is to kill as many Innocents/Detectives without getting caught. Same goes for Innocents/Detectives, you find and kill the Traitors and hope to god that your fellow Innocents and Detectives don't kill you first. Ever since then, I've been running a Garry's Mod - Trouble in Terrorist Town server since September 2013. It has grown the community I run and many friendships were formed due to it. This game will leave you lots of fun and good memories to come. I highly recommend 10/10

review: This is pretty much a must buy for most owners of Valve/Source engine games, so if you don't already have it, this is what you can expect: Garry's Mod is essentially a sandbox providing physics, posing, and props from any Source Engine game you own. It's what is used to make a lot of machinimas. There is also LUA scripting and a whole lot of usermade mods, so there are a few usermade gamemodes. Expect to have bought CS:S as a lot of everything uses those models, and expect to have friends to do crazy things with for hours in a giant sandbox enviornment to maximize enjoyment.

review: Thousands upon thousands of hours of content in this game, almost everything is user created, and there a plenty of game modes to play with people online, or with friends of your own, from extreme football throwdown (like the mario kart version of american football) to the classic TTT, A mystery team-based shooting gamemode, to sandbox, with countless addons, ragdolls and tools to make your own animations. Even further you can get invested in a good gaming community and one of their servers, becoming a regular is usually rewarding when everyone recognises you. Overall garry's mod is more than it seems, pick up a couple of friends, or find a good reliable server with friendly people, and have great fun. Scores: Value for money: 10/10, honestly, I can't stress this more, even free to play games don't get 10's. Content: 9.5/10. the majority of the content is user-created, and as much as this is great, it can't get a perfect score. Fun capacity: 9/10, although generally a fun game to play, no game really can get an all out fun feel, especially all the time. Community: this section doesn't even get a score, because that doesn't make sense. But in all seriousness, if you're on a server with good owners/admins/moderators usually you don't have problems with disrespectful players. Graphics: who gives a f***? Overall: 9.7/10 would garry again.

game-hours: 349.2
review: 8.9/10 Such an open door for developers of all kinds. The amount of things you can do in Garry's mod, is far too big to post in a review. You can build rockets, stab bystanders, build sleds, or play 'Flappy Garry'. While playing Garry's mod is not competitive, or something to master. You can breath lightly while playing it, and not take it too seriously. When you first open Garry's mod, you will play sandbox, using aspects from other games you can build amazing, or laughable things. The amount of scenarios you can create in sandbox alone, is breathtaking. Yet you have still to discover, many intresting and vastly different gamemodes to enjoy: Trouble in terrorist town, in which you discover the Tratiors, who are killing innocent terrorists in order to win rounds. Roleplay, build houses and and buy cars with the money you get from the money printers you hid from the police. Murder, go around with your knife murdering innocent bystanders, trying to hide your identity. And many, many more... While Garry's mod cannot be called a great game in it's own right. The way it uses aspects from others, and allows you to manipulate and use them, is entertaining. Garry's mod is a game you play on all day, not realising the time. I've racked up not too far short of 200 hours in a couple months, without feeling bored or tired of it at any point.

review: Don't think, buy.
game-hours: 148.5
review: Probably the greatest game/mod of all time, for mainly two reasons that are really cool and amazing. Highly recommended. One reason is that you can do anything your brain desires, theres rarely ANY limitations, the only limitations there ARE is that sometimes when you wanna do something, you can't find the things you need to do whatever you were going to do, but then you usually find something else to do that you have the stuff to do it with. But you can access ALL source (i.e. Counter Strike, Half-Life 2, Portal, Team Fortress 2, and anything made by Valve really) models, objects, characters, vehicles, npc's, etc. It has a large community workshop, which has characters, player models, npc's, gamemodes, tools, objects, and more. There is also a section called "Dupes" which has community creations, i.e. a Heavy wearing a baby on it's head, things like that. You can do so much in this game and there's so many things you can do that it's impossible to describe EVERY single thing that is possible in GMod. The second reason why it's amazing, is that you can make Machinimas (A Machinima is a video/skit made with a game, but the video isn't a commentary or anything like that, it actually has a storyline) with GMod. You can spawn in a character (preferably a ragdoll) and then place a camera facing the ragdoll, and you can either move the ragdoll a little bit, then take a screenshot with any software you have that lets you do so, or just use the screenshot function in GMod or Steam, or you can use the Phys Gun to move the character around and have that as your video. There is many really good GMod Machinima creators out there, such as DasBoSchitt, many good GMod Machinima videos, such as Team Fabulous 2, and there is a lot of good GMod Machinima series, such as the GMod Idiot Box. Overall, GMod has so many features, so many useful things, that make it the greatest game of all time, because there isn't any rules like you get banned from GMod for using an addon that wasn't from the GMod Workshop, because there is things like that on the GMod website itself. So that gives you a lot of access to a lot of things, which makes GMod truly, a revolutionary game.I HIGHLY recommend this game, I recommend this game more than any other game because it's so many features. And that's why GMod truly is, a revolutionary game.

game-hours: 40.7
review: Pointless fun. If you enjoy sandbox and creative games, then Garry's Mod is for you. Using source games for content, you can create damn near anything. I enjoy putting rockets on a bath tub and then tethering it to the ground, causing it to either fly in circles or sporadically, killing almost everyone around. The more source games you have in your library, the better your catalogue of items in game is. There are user generated content, but a lot of it either doesn't work or relies on something that's incompatible with most others. As for online play, there are a ton of options to choose from. You can do regular sandbox play, jump into a RL game and take on the role of burglar, theif, mayor, kingpin, etc., play a game of jailbreak where you start as a prisoner and have to listen to the warden for orders or your stay will be cut short. These are just a few of the gametypes online, and there are a lot more. If you are good at creating machinima, you can also use this game for just that. I've watched countless G-Mod videos (some hilarious, some just sad), and wish I had the patience to create one myself.

Most roleplaying servers DO require Counter Strike Source, so I would definitely reccomend buying CSS along with Garry's Mod if you plan on doing any long term online gaming. The game rarely lags, and since it runs on the Source engine, most CPUs can run it with ease. If you're a creative spirit or just like to have crazy fun, buy this game. I totally reccomend it.

review: Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. The game's makers give you the tools and leave you to play! You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions -- whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet -- that's up to you. If you're not too great at construction -- don't worry! You can place a variety of characters in silly positions.

Wanna Better Discription of sandbox? ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. We give you the tools and leave you to play. You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions - whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet - that's up to you. If you're not too great at construction - don't worry! You can place a variety of characters in silly positions. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I Personnally give this SPECTATCULAR game a 900000000000000000000000/10 AngelicCookies

game-hours: 553.1
review: Garry's Mod is a game that is often bought to play modded multiplayer servers like prop hunt, TTT and Dark RP but what many people overlook is the main feature of the game: creation. Garry's mod is a game where you can build things, both big and small, simple or incredibly complex - Garry's mod defines the genre Sandbox, within the game you create a world to your liking, invite your friends to it, populate it with npcs or literally anything you want to do - its a world that can free your mind, built to your design, and of course you're not alone - you'll have the tools and entertainment provided by possibly the most productive and inventive community gaming has ever seen, as is hinted at in the game's title, Garry's mod is a game built around the concept of modding and there are thousands of mods that can enhance your experience. I've had quite the time with Garry's Mod, among all the games I've played there will never be another experience like it, and that's really the beauty of the game, when it comes down to what you create and what you do with Garry's Mod - you'll end up with a completely unique experience shaped to how you play - no other Garry's Modder will have the same experience as you had with the game, and no other game will give you the same experience as Garry's Mod.

game-hours: 249.2
review: Best. Game. Ever. Period. Well, this is an "in-depth" review sooo... First of all, you can never be bored on this game and you will always be doing something crazy, unless you're a serious person. The more creative you are, the better. You can build many structures and even build robots with all the tools at your disposal. There are ragdolls, props, vehicles, and many maps to offer. The game gets even better when you add the workshop. The community makes content that you can download and there are in-game community-made dupes that you can screw around with. Garry's Mod also has spawned many ridiculous and fun gamemodes, like GMod Tower, Trouble in Terrorist Town (TTT), Prop Hunt, Murder, STOP IT! Slender, and many more. Overall, this game is totally worth $9.99 (that is how much I bought it for) and it should be worth more because you can play games within a game in GMod. That is crazy, much like this game.

game-hours: 78.3
review: Garry's mod isn't a game. It's all the tools you need to make a game. You can make essetially whatever you want if you have the skill to do so. You can either screw around with tools and props in anyway twisted way you can imagine, or you can just download other peoples creations and be impressed. If for some reason you are new to Garry's Mod and never played before, the best downloads I can suggest are Prop Hunt, Trouble in Terrorist Town, and if you're looking for some "WTF" moments, try out Elevator Source once. (seriously, only try it once of twice at most. The things themselves don't really change too much, but the order they come in does) There are more than hundreds of maps to download and explore, with tons of different custom gamemodes. There's even one named Melonbomber, which is literally just Bomberman. Garry's Mod is very social driven. Try to have some friends to play with, or settle for just random matches online (though playing with random people has a LOT of downfalls compared to just playing with friends) However Garry's Mod does have some prerequsites, the most important being Counter Strike: Source. Garry's Mod uses the textures and resources from that game in particular for a lot of the maps people create, and without it, you'll mostly have ERRORS and pink/black checker patterns on everything. There are other ways to get the textures and resources though, which you can find very easily from a Google search. After that, almost any Source Engine game you own can be used for textures and props to pull from into Garry's Mod. There are also hundreds of custom props and characters to download from the Workshop. Garry's Mod will seem complicated and intimidating to set up at first, but once you get the more important tools installed, you'll be filling up that hard drive with anything from maps of castles and cruiseships, to replica bottles of Mountain Dew and drivable mechs.

This is a type of game that allows your creativity flow through the models and characters from various games such as Half life, Counter Strike, and Team fortress two. With many community made mods, vehicles, and weapons this game truly never ends allowing for hours on end to be spent in this game.

review: I absolutely ADORE this game. It's my favourite game ever. If you're thinking about buying this game don't hesisate. It's really hard to explain what this game really is. It really just sums up about everything you can wish in a sandbox. You can spawn all the props from half life 2, counter strike and most of the games that run on source engine. use those props to make a giant robot, a catapult, make a flying car, DO WHATEVER YOU WANT! It doesn't sound too exciting, but belive me, it is. It has realistic physics guys, YOU can spawn everything, and you can install addons for even more cool content with the click of a button!!!! This game is crazy.. But also crazy fun. Don't like sandbox games? Doesn't matter! You have freaking GAMEMODES! You can play TTT or Murder or Prop Hunt.. Zombie survival, Just NAME IT! I can't express my love for this game in a review.. But trust me. You will love this game. To sum garry's mod up in 5 words: It has content for everyone. For shooters, builders, griefers, survivors, etc. For the shooters you have shooting gamemodes. For the builders you have sandbox. Same goes for griefers... Survivors? Oh let's give 'em gmod stranded. *** I highly recommend this game. I think this is the best game is the history of gaming. But that's my opinion. Find yours. Explore it. Find it. And last but not least... Have fun. -Farian

GMod used to be Perfect but with the Updates, It went VERY slow, I miss the Toybox, and Addons can Infect your Game which sucks alot when you have 500 Addons and then 1 of it s up your Whole Game. It is a good Game that I DO recommend (I mean, 10 Bucks.) yet Still its not the Best Game.

But this game is literally the ultimate: Action, Multiplayer, Role-playing, Puzzle, Racing, Sandbox, Strategy and Simulator. review: Let me ask you a question. In the instace of random boredom and no school/work/family obligations, you'd naturally go and do something, right? Specifically, something that is fun by your standards, yes? Alright. Now could you tell me the approximate number of people who disliked doing whatever it is they picked because they found themselves in an instance such as that one? Naught. That is exactly why you cannot be wrong when you pick this game. With so many addons, countless multiplayer gamemodes, possibility of making gorgeous and/or stupid screenshots and the ability to attach dozens of thrusters to anything and watch the physics engine do it's magic is what will keep you coming back for more. The fact that you need other games to extend the possibilities of Garry's Mod may put some off, but with the ever-updating community addons, there's always gonna be an alternative.

review: Within this game, you are a gamer, playing as your favorite video game character within some abandoned video game sanctuary. You've pretty much completed every objective of the main game, and now you are bored; you must find a way to occupy/entertain yourself for the remainder of your precious free time here in the universe. --With this, I find it to be no surprise that we humans have come to thrive with life in such desolate, austere environments; as we have within the confines of our reality here on earth. We, like the players, within this indolent game we call life, start from nothing, and sprout out of the vain emptiness with life, like wildflowers after rain, and make amazing things with our tools as human beings. It is with this simple sandbox game that we humans are able to truly contemplate the reality of our ingenious resourcefulness and the fullest extent of our creative capabilities, as we, like artists of blank canvasses, create astonishing works out of nothing, finding valuable amusement within the vain emptiness of the blank slate that is what life is to be, and is what this game is to give the user;

review: This game is possibly one of the best sandbox games out there that has a fair price. What makes this different from other titles is it has a growing community that not just plays the game, but makes mods, gamemodes and much more content. Garry's Mod is great, but the things it lacks is graphics and textures. Since Garry's Mod takes textures from other games, you need to get that game so errors, missing textures and script errors dont pop up. But its a small price to pay just to get Counter-Strike: Source. Garry's Mod's community is filled with large maps and mods that are interesting. This game is amazing. So I give it a 97/100.

review: I loved this game.... But you need good internet to play well...... Things I disliked about this game: -Very long loading screens for servers (Downloading Steam workshop file mods) -Purple and black missing textures that almost every player will encounter when they first download Garry's mod unless they have Counter Strike; source -Unruly admins letting other players kill you whenever they want (Mostly on Sandbox) -Kids with very high voices that spam the voice chat Things I liked about this game: +Unlimited possiblities of random scenes and creative artworks +All the playerbase mods (There are some really cool ones :D) +The default tools (Most people underate these but these make the game for me; Welding, stretching, and balloons +The FUN (You can have lots of laughs with your friends in private servers or public ones while smashing each other with props, flying planes, attaching planes to helicopters and LOTS more. Overall I think high of this game and it is fun to create your own unique stuff. My favorite sandbox :)

game-hours: 73.7
review: Garry's Mod is a physics sandbox. Unlike regular games there aren't any predefined aims or goals. The game's makers give you the tools and leave you to play! You spawn objects and weld them together to create your own contraptions -- whether that's a car, a rocket, a catapult or something that doesn't have a name yet -- that's up to you. If you're not too great at construction -- don't worry! You can place a variety of characters in silly positions.

Some people might think it's easy to build advanced creations, but to tell you the truth, I think it takes skill to build planes, huge robots and other big creations. Basically i'm just saying that you need to know how to use all the tools like thrusters, ropes, and other advanced tools. game-hours: 1056.9
review: What is there to say about Garry's Mod that hasn't been said already? There is no purer joy than tossing explosive barrels at your friends or building robots that shoot semi-phallic projectiles at your opponents. Garry's Mod is a game that literally has infinite possibilites. You can build anything, do anything, and with the Workshop allowing custom content and with the ability to mount any Source engine game or mod, you can have just about any asset you need. Whether you wish to roleplay, build, just mess around, pose screenshots, make machinima, play a variant of clue, or escape from creepy internet memes, Garry's Mod has it all. There's even a gamemode where you're just on an insane elevator, there is literally no limit to the possibilities. Since the possibilities are so expansive, there is almost no way for you to not enjoy this game. It's at the point where it's a must-have.

game-hours: 249.1
review: Garry's Mod. You'll most likely do absolutley nothing productive in your first hour of playing. You'll look at the NPCs. Maybe face pose some ragdolls into genius works of art or hideous abominations. You'll look at the weapons. Get a mod or two. All that kind of stuff- but then, your flat world of near-pointlessness will expand. You'll make movies that desrve -2 oscars, but are still amazing. You can make a minigame using a save that will rocket you to the top of the most popular saves list for about 3-5 days. You'll make vehicles out of everything, and only spam thrusters when your friends are in a vehicle. You can go on a server and play with the community. You can even make an addon for the community. So, why wait to buy this, when you can get it now and do all of the things I just said. Why? Because in Garry's Mod, you can do anything- and yes, that includes making a pigeon-powered bathtub tank if you have the right mods.

game-hours: 70.3
review: once you start playing you cant stop.
game-hours: 684.3
review: This game gives all your favorite vavle games mixed together. You can spawn npc's from many games from the steam workshop and also get many weapons from the workshop as well as a many veriety of vehicles to player models, or just some props from other games. This game gives you many different multiplayer game types. The gamemodes are Hunger Games where players are pitt against each other to fight/scavenge/survive. Perp lets you get a job buy a vehicle a house and even grow drugs, carefull though if you get caught by the cops your in jail or worse. suicide barrels is a gamemode where there is a team of exploding barrels and a group of survivers who hold out against them. Prop hunt is where you have to find some props to win the game, but there is a catch, some players are props and move around and hide from you making the game hard. There is a good amount of role playing gamemodes such as dark rp, half life rp, 1940's rp, and many more. And then there is Trouble in Terrorist Town, where everybody is a terrorist but they have to find the evil team of terrorists who have to eliminate the innocent terrorist. And much, much more. There is singleplayer were it is just sandbox mode that you can just mess around or make a battle or whatever you want. I strongly recommend this game for people who like vavle games or like to build stuff. Also i recommend you get orange box and cs:s for no missing textures.

review: This game gives all your favorite vavle games mixed together. You can spawn npc's from many games from the steam workshop and also get many weapons from the workshop as well as a many veriety of vehicles to player models, or just some props from other games. This game gives you many different multiplayer game types. The gamemodes are Hunger Games where players are pitt against each other to fight/scavenge/survive. Perp lets you get a job buy a vehicle a house and even grow drugs, carefull though if you get caught by the cops your in jail or worse. suicide barrels is a gamemode where there is a team of exploding barrels and a group of survivers who hold out against them. Prop hunt is where you have to find some props to win the game, but there is a catch, some players are props and move around and hide from you making the game hard. There is a good amount of role playing gamemodes such as dark rp, half life rp, 1940's rp, and many more. And then there is Trouble in Terrorist Town, where everybody is a terrorist but they have to find the evil team of terrorists who have to eliminate the innocent terrorist. And much, much more. There is singleplayer were it is just sandbox mode that you can just mess around or make a battle or whatever you want. game-hours: 482.3
review: Being a sandbox you may enter the game on your first go just wandering what to do, You have a few main groups of things. Props; the general objects of the world you can pick them up, throw them, stick them together. Entities; you can interact with these, they are the health vials and the vehicles. Tools; These are a group of tools which you use of props to weld, rope, ignite, remove and colour, there are a lot more but too many to list. NPCs; These are the AI, they are taken from the Half life 2 games so Hostile AI is Combine/Alien and Friendly AI is the Rebels. What really makes this game is the mods, they adds tons of content. Bored of the sandbox? Try TTT, Prop hunt etc Don't like the weapons in the game? Download a laser/WW2 mod.

review: If you are reading this and this game isn't in your library, you're an idiot. Seriously, this is one of steam's best games and arguably one of the best games ever. Well, it isn't a game per say, but it's close enough. It is an open source engine that takes props, maps and characters from other games made from the source engine and allows you to do as you want. Make a deep and meaningful adventure game, make a platformer that makes people want to pull their teeth out or just put characters from Half-Life and Counter-Strike in random sex positions and giggle. This game is truly the perfect game as there is infinite things to do in it. If you aren't too imaginitive you can always jump online and play TTT or Prop Hunt or one of the millions of other game modes that other, more intelligent(or just more nerdy), people have made. A must have for PC gamers everywhere especially since you can pick it up for no more than 3 dollars when it is on sale. 10/10

game-hours: 20.9
review: If you're one of those people like me who enjoy a nice sandbox game in between stomping on Goomba and saving Hyrule, then Garry's Mod is the game for you. Originally a mod of the Half-Life series, Garry's Mod combines first person shooting and Minecraft. Not only can you enjoy a good firefight with your friends, you can even design the map you fight on! With multiple game modes including Sandbox, Prop Hunt, Trouble in Terrorist Town, and Death Run, Garry's Mod will never get old. At only fifteen dollars this is a great value and will rack up hours on your Steam account. Between me and my handful of Steam friends we have racked up at least a couple hundred hours on this game. If you are looking for a time waisting sandbox game then Garry's Mod is the game for you.

game-hours: 65.9
review: Garry's Mod is one of those games you hear about from a friend, go to all kind of effort to get working correctly so you can play it with them, and in the end, it's all worth it. This game definately has it's quirks, don't get me wrong. It suffers issues from new users missing textures to other assorted bugs like control-z crashing a server. But the game just offers so much, whether you want to play a gamemode or make one, Garry's Mod is really a great tool. I never knew I could get such enjoyment out of $2.49. Garry's Mod recieves an 8.5/10; if it fixed some bugs and made it easier to start playing it could be a 9.5/10.

review: Have you ever had "The Itch"? No, not the one your Girlfriend gave you... I'm talking about the itch you get from a great idea. The itch that you have to act upon. The urge that has existed from the birth of the Human race. Man's will to create that which he dreams. But... How? How can two hands, and ten fingers create that which can only exist as a bylaw, as a fugitive of physics? Reject physics. Reject reality. substitute your own. Admittedly, Garry's mod is not the final solution. Gmod is a rough tool, a hammer of creation. It was not the first of its kind. And it will not be the last. And currently, it is the closest that you can get to being God, with a universe at your command.

review: Ah, Garry's Mod. One of the most beautiful gems in the whole Steam Library. Before I even give you my thoughts on this, I'm telling you right now. BUY THIS! It doesn't matter what type of games you like to play, as this is a sandbox game, where you can really do anything. Using the Steam Workshop, you can download add-ons that enhance the expirence, and heck, even make your own! Keeping in mind that this is a mod of Valve's Source Engine for games such as Team Fortress 2, Left 4 Dead, Portal, and others, you can mount these games on, and extend the madness! So, yeah. If you pretty much have an imagination, get this. It's worth it. I give Garry's Mod a 10/10.

game-hours: 94.4
review: Garry's Mod is an excellent experience with multiple gametypes from what is essentially hide and seek but with humans and objects, to roleplaying games. If you get a group of friends and jump on you will have hours of enjoyment from this Mod. Please note that this game is a Source Engine mod and requires a Source Engine game to be able to run it, such as Half-Life 2 or Counter-Strike: Source, and that different gametypes require models from differet Source Engine games/mods. I would recommend having Half-Life 2, Counter-Strike: Source, and Team Fortress 2 installed along with this game. To see my gameplay of Garry's Mod, visit my YouTube channel below; I occasionally post videos of this game!

There is nothing to not like, amazing job developers. The game runs smooth the graphics are good and the gameplay is fun no matter what your into so read this review then just hurry up and buy the freaking game. Best 14 pounds i ever spent. My only problems have been while on sandbox or sometimes online getting chucked back to my desktop and garrysmod crashing for no reason. But i think the main problem is if you want the game to actually work online, you need Counter Strike Source. This though is not the developers fault. When people made the gamemodes such as Prop Hunt or TTT they made them using mainly CSS textures and models so if your getting this game, buy it with Counter strike source for that bit extra.

review: Garry's Mod is a fantastic game. You can build literally anything here, like rockets and jet-powered car-boat party-stuff things?
